alert.note: Alert for Cobb (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 1:13PM EST until January 10 at 12:40AM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Peachtree City GA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Georgia... Noses Creek at Powder Springs Rd at Powder Springs affecting Cobb County. For the Sweetwater Creek...including Powder Springs...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Noses Creek at Powder Springs Rd at Powder Springs. * WHEN...From this afternoon to just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Flood stage is reached. Minor flooding will occur in the woodlands and the natural flood plain upstream and downstream from the gage at Powder Springs Road. A walkway parallel to the creek on the right bank will be under two feet of water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:45 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 11.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 12:45 PM EST Tuesday was 11.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 11.6 feet late this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage this evening. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 11.5 feet on 05/07/2003. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 1245 AM EST.
